basics.name: Chun-Yu "Jerry" Hou
basics.label: Robotics Researcher
basics.summary: A dedicated researcher and Master's student in Robotic Systems Development with experience in autonomous vehicle perception, SLAM, and sensor fusion. Proven ability to lead projects, enhance system accuracy, and reduce costs through innovative solutions in 3D scene reconstruction and multi-sensor integration.

work.name: Industrial Technology Research Institute
work.position: Associate Researcher in Autonomous Vehicle Perception
work.summary: Worked on the perception team for autonomous vehicles, focusing on sensor fusion, SLAM, and system optimization.
highlights: Enhanced visual localization system accuracy by 50% using 3D Gaussian Splatting scene reconstruction
Led a team to develop 4D radar-inertial SLAM, achieving 0.26 RMSE accuracy and reducing system cost by 60%
Architected a real-time multi-sensor (radar, LiDAR, camera) tracking system using Unscented Kalman Smoother
Led development of an automated 4D radar-LiDAR calibration pipeline, reducing calibration time by 75%
Mentored 4 interns on sensor fusion and real-time perception algorithms

projects.name: Boosting Stochastic Trajectory Prediction using Conditional Latent Diffusion Model
projects.summary: Co-led the development of a stochastic trajectory prediction system using a conditional latent diffusion model and proposed a semantic traffic fusion method that boosted accuracy.

projects.name: Representing Scenes as Compositional Generative Neural Feature Fields with Hair Conditions
projects.summary: Innovated a method to manipulate specific object attributes in scenes by applying targeted conditions to compositional generative neural feature fields, preserving overall object integrity.
